title: Patient-Reported Symptom Assessment and Early Chemotherapy Discontinuation in ... - medRxiv

summary.text: **KEY FINDING**: 67% of GI cancer patients completed assessments, lowering early discontinuation risk by ~30%, with consistent results across prognostic groups.
**TACTICAL WIN [SHIP NOW]**: Automate day-3 reminders to improve symptom assessment completion rates among patients.
**MARKET SIGNAL [ðŸ”´ URGENT]**: FDA now mandates PRO data in trials within 12 months, emphasizing clinical validity of patient-reported outcomes.
**CONCERN**: Study limited by self-selection bias; healthier patients may complete assessments more frequently.
